title: HP Land Revenue Act
details:
The procedural backbone of Revenue Administration.
Sec 34: Duty to report land acquisition/succession within 3 months to Patwari.
Sec 35: Procedure for Mutations attestation.
Sec 45: Presumption of truth attached to entries in Jamabandi.
Sec 107: Power of Revenue Officer to define boundaries (Demarcation).
Sec 118: Penalty for encroachment on roads.
Sec 163: Power to eject encroachers from Govt land.

title: HP Tenancy & Land Reforms Act
details:
Major social justice legislation.
Sec 104: Automatic vesting of proprietary rights in tenants.
Sec 118: Bans transfer of land to non-agriculturists in HP. Permission only by State Govt (Cabinet) or DC (limited).
Objective: 'Land to the Tiller'.

title: HP Village Common Lands Act
details:
Vesting & Utilization: Took 'Shamlat' (Common) land from the village community and vested it in the State Government for distribution to the landless (1 Acre Scheme).
Exception: Land used for common purposes like paths/grazing/cremation was retained.

title: HP Holdings Consolidation Act
details:
Chakbandi: Aimed to prevent fragmentation of holdings. Combines scattered plots into a compact block called a 'Chak' for better irrigation and farming efficiency.
Killabandi: Rectangularization of fields during consolidation.

title: HP Ceiling on Land Holdings Act
details:
Limits the maximum land a family can own.
Limit: Approx 10 to 30 Acres (Standard Acres) depending on land quality (irrigated vs barren). Surplus land is vested in the State.
Unit: Family of 5 members.

title: HP Nautor Land Rules
details:
Governs the grant of government wasteland ('Nautor') to landless/poor residents.
Limit: Generally up to 20 Bighas.
Current Status: Heavily restricted by the Forest Conservation Act, 1980.

title: HP Transfer of Land (Regulation) Act
details:
Specific protection for Scheduled Tribes.
Key Provision: Prohibits transfer of land from a Tribal to a Non-Tribal in Scheduled Areas without the specific permission of the Deputy Commissioner.

title: HP Panchayati Raj Act
details: Section 12: Empowers the Gram Panchayat to remove encroachments from public paths and drains. The Patwari assists by providing revenue record evidence for these proceedings.

title: RFCTLARR Act (Land Acquisition)
details:
Right to Fair Compensation and Transparency in Land Acquisition. Replaced the 1894 Act.
Role: Patwaris assist in the Social Impact Assessment (SIA) and survey measurement for compensation calculation.

title: PESA Act (Tribal Rights)
details:
Applies to Scheduled Areas (Kinnaur, Lahaul-Spiti, Pangi).
Gram Sabha is the supreme authority for land alienation and ownership of Minor Forest Produce.
Consultation: Mandatory before land acquisition in these areas.

title: HP Abolition of Land Revenue Act
details:
Abolished land revenue on 'Uneconomic Holdings'.
Definition: Holdings up to 2.5 Acres or paying less than â‚¹5 revenue are exempt from paying land revenue.

title: HP Land Records Manual
details:
The 'Bible' for Patwaris.
Chapter 3: Duties of Patwaris.
Chapter 4: Duties of Kanungos.
Chapter 9: Harvest Inspection (Girdawari) procedure.

title: Limitation Act (Appeals)
details:
Appeal to Collector: 30 Days.
Appeal to Commissioner: 60 Days.
Appeal to Financial Commissioner: 90 Days. (Section 14 of HP Land Revenue Act).
